data.title: remove InvisibleToEnemy, use plain Cloak for mines
fix desync in Cloak.IsVisible
Performance Issues With April 07 Version
data.body:
As per the title. 

FPS seems to be significantly lower (10-20 FPS) for the latest unstable versions than the latest stable release.

Radeon 4850 HD
Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU E8400 @ 3.00GHz, 3600 MHz (Overclocked)
Dual DDR2 SDRAM 2 GB, Real Clock    400 MHz (DDR), Effective 800 MHz

data.title: Shroud Issues With Chinook
data.body:
As per the title.

The Chinook oddly seems to regenerate shroud while landed.

data.title: Hero Units Don't Count as Dead When Dying in Transport
data.body:
As per the title.

The 1 unit limit for Tanya and Volkov doesn't reset when they die while these units are loaded in a transport.

data.title: Debug the chosen target from AutoTarget for desync issues
data.body: AutoTarget: is definitely still busted and responsible for #2843 but I don't know why. Is it wrong timing or does it pick the wrong actor? Is it just one edge case or is this broken in multiple ways? Did per-player-shrouds introduce this, is it a rounding error due to ranges in this strange coordinate system or problems with Mono vs .NET? Does cloaking not work properly with AutoTarget?

data.title: Convert FindUnitsInCircle radius later from float to int
data.body: I tried to fix problems with AutoTarget: ranges and wanted to calculate it more precisely and deterministic. In the end nothing really worked out, but I kept this little cleanup. It does not change game behavior, but maybe makes PVecInt.FromRadius more useful. This change essentially lets the code of FindUnitsInCircle() look analogous to Combat.IsInRange().

data.title: fixed error with rock_canyon map
data.body: can be merged now.

data.title: Fixed missing cliff in bombardment islands
data.body: #2974 by @kyrreso

data.title: Allow the creation of art without palettes
data.body:
I think that Palettes files are a real pain to manage. 

I have read documentations about them:
- http://openra-modding.tumblr.com/
- https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Palettes-and-Remaps

I have searched for tools to convert Westwood palette files to Microsoft compatible .PAL ones (Photoshop can't read Westwood/OpenRA's PAL files):
- http://libregraphicsworld.org/blog/entry/gimp-add-ons-types-installation-management
- http://ra2.gamebanana.com/tools/3696
- http://www.selapa.net/swatchbooker/
- http://www.ppmsite.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=33061&highlight=
- http://randomselect.piiym.net/tools/
  ... 

But after some tests, I think it's REALLY frustrating to manage these .PAL files.
It would be SO much easier to be able to create PNGs with or without indexed palettes...

Units would just have to be displayed like this:
![aircraftcarrier](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/347179/48e93772-9ea6-11e2-80e1-6d66167f1e6d.png)

OpenRA could just load these PNG files and read their color informations that are already stored inside them
- no extra palette file to add
- no pain for the mod creators/authors

Simpler way to create units, terrain tiles = more modders

data.title: update for cnc-classic -- updated explosions, more...
Don't save transparent pixel color to avoid UI glitches
data.body: I simply unchecked everything in Gimp on PNG export to fix this.

Missing cliff inserted into map bombardment islands

Should be tested, since it is my first pull request...

data.title: slowed down *make animations to 80-tick
data.body:
Animations were faster than they should be. Reduced to 80 tick. They look appropriate now, and close to the original.
I made TMPL and FIX 60 because it looked more natural. TMPL is slow to begin with, but it would look ok at 80, too.

data.title: Fix classic mods yaml
data.body: Fixes breakage introduced by #2917.

data.title: Separate wiki update into it's own script
data.body:
Last time the update operation failed because I got the paths wrong. I can't really simulate the build server paths on my home machine, but I still hope this just fixes it.

```
cp: cannot stat `../DOCUMENTATION.md': No such file or directory
build@build:~/openra-package$ dir
checkout-and-build.sh  OpenRA  OpenRA-build  packages
```

data.title: added rock_canyon map. Removed delta dunes (old)
data.body: Added one new map. Trim redundant old one.

data.title: snow tileset in C&C is too white
data.body:
When you compare the C&C snow tileset with the RA one, you can see a clear difference. In C&C it's almost completely white, which is very hard on the eyes. In RA it's got grey mixed in, giving it a "dirtier" look, which is far, far easier on the eyes. 

I'm not sure why this difference exists between the tilesets.

It's a serious problem for playing. I hate playing the C&C snow tilesets because it's painful to look at. I would be grateful if someone could make it look like RA.

data.title: Map chooser polish & refactoring
data.body:
These changes add some much needed polish to the map chooser in C&C, and removes some of the issues associated with the map chooser logic.

The map list is now generated synchronously, but the previews generation is async within the MapPreviewWidget.

data.title: updated skull_valley map
data.body:
Updated skull_valley map. 
(Replaces delta_dunes, which was an alpha version).

data.title: Fixes C&C cheats menu crash and adds more buttons to it's lobby
data.body: @pchote please review.

data.title: Added support for draggable BackgroundWidgets
data.body:
This needs proper testing. This patch should not change the current widget behaviour (if it does then I failed) until you set Draggable to true.
This is hopefully going to make way for some more UI improvements/additions in the future.

data.title: Widget CHEATS_PANEL has no child DESYNC of type ButtonWidget
data.body:
The recent desync button was added to the RA yaml, but not C&C.

Please at least test these things in C&C before merging them to bleed - subtle edge cases that aren't apparant in RA is one thing, but introducing obvious crashes in a common feature is another entirely.

data.title: editor: convert map between tilesets
data.body: It would be really nice if you could convert maps made in one tilset (e.g. snow) to another quickly (e.g. desert, temperate...). Since they all share the same terrain features, this wouldn't be too hard, would it?

data.title: allow a weapon to have different ranges for ground & air
data.body: Some units have differing ranges depending on whether they are shooting at ground or air (e.g. APC in C&C, and potentially others like mammoth tank, orcas, adv. guard tower, and anything with rockets). Right now the only way to do this is to have a primary and secondary weapon. It would be nice though if it could be simplified to have different ranges depending on whether the target were a ground unit or air unit.

data.title: construction yard HP reduced 2000 -> 1500
data.body: Now that MCV is buildable again, the conyard doesn't need to be the ultra-heavy armored bunker it has been. Now a nuke can almost kill it.

data.title: filter destroyed actors correctly in PerformKeyboardOrderOnSelection
data.body: Fixes #2947

data.title: AI Cheats and Auto-IDs/Attacks Disguised Spies
data.body:
As per the title.

This could apply to all AIs, but I've noticed this crop up blatantly with the test one in some recent games.

data.title: Improve Mobile Gap Generators
data.body:
While I can understand the Mobile Gap Generator (MGG) having obvious disadvantages compared to the Gap Generator (GG) structure in order to give the latter appeal, the penalties the MGG is slapped with are excessive, especially since it ties up vehicle production for 36 seconds! The premium you pay for mobility and a lack of power consumption is as follows:
- Vastly increased fragility: 200 HP vs 1000 HP
- 50% greater build cost: $1500 vs $1000
- 50% longer build time: 36 vs 24 seconds.
- 33% smaller shroud (4 vs 6).

Obviously this is way too onerous.

Suggestions for improving MGGs so they're worth using:
- Fold the Mobile Radar Jammer (MRJ) capabilities into the MGG. MRJs seem way too niche and redundant to begin with anyways, and this just makes narrative sense as Gap tech disrupts radar/GPS capabilities.
- Reduce the cost of the GG to $800 and the MGG to $1200. Why on earth is the GG priced so much higher than the Turret and AA gun? Why would you ever pay $1500 for an MGG when that nets you a Medium Tank + Light Tank or Ranger or Artillery and then some?
- Reduce the build time of both the GG and the MGG to ~18 seconds; I'm not sure why the build time was so long for either to begin with, but in the case of the MGG it is ridiculously excessive; tying up vehicle production for 36 seconds to build this thing is just crazy. Decreasing MGG's build time to 24 seconds should be done at a bare minimum.
- Increase sight range to 10. This helps it act in the capacity of a support vehicle, and it's not as big an advantage as it otherwise would be in light of the GPS Satellite.
